message.content:
cs.NI, cs.SY, cs.CR, cs.DC, cs.PL 

This paper discusses the application of Software-Defined Networking (SDN) in Smart Grid communications, which falls under the category of computer networks (cs.NI). The paper also addresses the need for reliable and real-time communication, which is a key aspect of control systems (cs.SY). Additionally, the paper discusses the use of Network Calculus (NC) logic, which is a mathematical theory used in the analysis of computer networks and communication systems (cs.CR). The paper also discusses the need for dynamic service-aware network (re-)configuration, which is a topic in distributed computing (cs.DC). Finally, the paper proposes the use of a SDN controller, which is a software system and falls under the category of programming languages (cs.PL).
